info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 5:30AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A line of heavy downpours with gusty winds will impact portions of Windham, eastern Tolland, Norfolk, Essex, Middlesex, south central Nantucket, central Dukes, Barnstable, Bristol, Suffolk, Worcester, eastern Hampden, Plymouth, northeastern Newport, northern Bristol, northwestern Washington, Kent and Providence Counties through 700 AM EST... At 527 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of heavy downpours along a line extending from near Eastford to 28 miles southeast of Chilmark. Movement was north at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Heavy downpours could lead to localized urban poor drainage ponding or minor flooding. ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Portions of north-central Massachusetts may still be experiencing wintry precipitation. Locations impacted include... Boston, Worcester, Providence, Lowell, Cambridge, New Bedford, Brockton, Quincy, Lynn, Fall River, Newton, Warwick, Cranston, Lawrence, Somerville, Pawtucket, Framingham, Haverhill, Waltham and Malden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Slow down and do not drive through flooded roadways.
